## SQL: Statement Fundamentals


### LIMIT

LIMIT allows you to limit the number of rows you get back after a query

**Syntax**: 

```{sql, eval = FALSE}
-- Limit
SELECT column_1, column_2
FROM table_name
LIMIT number_of_rows;
```

**Example**: Select all rows and columns from the customer table and limit the number of rows to five.

```{sql, eval = FALSE}
-- Limit the number of rows to five
SELECT *
FROM customer
LIMIT 5;
```

```{r, echo=FALSE, message=FALSE}
library(RPostgreSQL)
connPostgres = dbConnect(
  dbDriver("PostgreSQL"), dbname="dvdrental", 
  host="localhost", port=5432, 
  user="postgres", password="asshole"
)
DBI::dbGetQuery(connPostgres,
"
SELECT *
FROM customer
LIMIT 5
")
```
